1.text: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

2.text: Who is this that darkens counsel by words without knowledge?

3.text: Gird up now your loins like a man; for I will demand of you, and answer you me.

4.text: Where were you when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare, if you have understanding.

5.text: Who has laid the measures thereof, if you know? or who has stretched the line on it?

6.text: Whereupon are the foundations thereof fastened? or who laid the corner stone thereof;

7.text: When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?

8.text: Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it broke forth, as if it had issued out of the womb?

9.text: When I made the cloud the garment thereof, and thick darkness a swaddling cloth for it,

10.text: And broke up for it my decreed place, and set bars and doors,

11.text: And said, Till now shall you come, but no further: and here shall your proud waves be stayed?

12.text: Have you commanded the morning since your days; and caused the dayspring to know his place;

13.text: That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, that the wicked might be shaken out of it?

14.text: It is turned as clay to the seal; and they stand as a garment.

15.text: And from the wicked their light is withheld, and the high arm shall be broken.

16.text: Have you entered into the springs of the sea? or have you walked in the search of the depth?

17.text: Have the gates of death been opened to you? or have you seen the doors of the shadow of death?

18.text: Have you perceived the breadth of the earth? declare if you know it all.

19.text: Where is the way where light dwells? and as for darkness, where is the place thereof,

20.text: That you should take it to the bound thereof, and that you should know the paths to the house thereof?

21.text: Know you it, because you were then born? or because the number of your days is great?

22.text: Have you entered into the treasures of the snow? or have you seen the treasures of the hail,

23.text: Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?

24.text: By what way is the light parted, which scatters the east wind on the earth?

25.text: Who has divided a watercourse for the overflowing of waters, or a way for the lightning of thunder;

26.text: To cause it to rain on the earth, where no man is; on the wilderness, wherein there is no man;

27.text: To satisfy the desolate and waste ground; and to cause the bud of the tender herb to spring forth?

28.text: Has the rain a father? or who has begotten the drops of dew?

29.text: Out of whose womb came the ice? and the hoary frost of heaven, who has gendered it?

30.text: The waters are hid as with a stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.

31.text: Can you bind the sweet influences of Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?

32.text: Can you bring forth Mazzaroth in his season? or can you guide Arcturus with his sons?

33.text: Know you the ordinances of heaven? can you set the dominion thereof in the earth?

34.text: Can you lift up your voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover you?

35.text: Can you send lightning, that they may go and say to you, Here we are?

36.text: Who has put wisdom in the inward parts? or who has given understanding to the heart?

37.text: Who can number the clouds in wisdom? or who can stay the bottles of heaven,

38.text: When the dust grows into hardness, and the clods stuck fast together?

39.text: Will you hunt the prey for the lion? or fill the appetite of the young lions,

40.text: When they couch in their dens, and abide in the covert to lie in wait?

41.text: Who provides for the raven his food? when his young ones cry to God, they wander for lack of meat.
